title: Shawl, 20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton, silk, glass
Technique: buttonhole, outline, and backstitch on plain weave
description: Hindu-type embroidered shawl with an eight-pointed star centered in a panel that has one half of the star repeated at both sides. In between are small birds. Flowering trees fill space above and below medallions. Both ends have twenty-one centimeter wide border of flowering trees set at a ninety-degree angle to the field as if growing from both ends. A narrow floral border is on both sides. Shawl is made from two pieces stitch together; one is very narrow.

tombstone.epitaph:
Shawl, 20th century.Medium: cotton, silk, glass
Technique: buttonhole, outline, and backstitch on plain weave. 1974-71-4.
